Key Match Events: The Texas Rangers defeated the Houston Astros 11-4 in Game 7 of the ALCS on October 24, 2023.
Corey Seager hit a home run in the first inning to give the Rangers an early lead.
Adolis Garcia singled to deep left field allowing Evan Carter to score, followed by Mitch Garver bringing Garcia home to make it 3-0.
Jose Abreu responded for the Astros with a single that allowed a runner to score, making it 3-1.
Adolis Garcia hit a home run in the 3rd inning, extending the Rangers' lead to 4-1.
Alex Bregman hit a home run for the Astros in the 3rd inning, making it 4-2.
The Rangers added four runs in the 4th inning, including a double from Evan Carter and a hit from Garcia.
Adolis Garcia was named MVP of the ALCS, recording three runs and five RBIs in Game 7.
Post-Match Reflections: Houston Manager Dusty Baker expressed pride in his team's performance despite the loss.
Dusty Baker highlighted the team's achievements over the past four years, including two World Series appearances and two Championship Series appearances.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Texas Rangers advance to the World Series for the first time since 2011.
The Rangers will face the winner of the NLCS between the Arizona Diamondbacks and Philadelphia Phillies.
